item.title: Primitives in C++ for Multithreading
item.description: Following is a short and concise overview of the synchronisation primitives provided in the C++ STL (C++ 20 and above). std::mutex allows a thread to modify a shared variable. std::mutex must be released by the same thread that locks it. other threads who try to acquire the lock are blocked other threads can avoid being blocked by using try_lock. This tries to use a lock, but is not blocked if lock is already taken.
